DataElement.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Q4 Past Month Actual Hours of Sleep at Night Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception of how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night, represented as a number of hours.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Past Month Hours of Actual Sleep at Night
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A question about an individual's hours of actual sleep at night.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Concepts.definition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Property.preferredName: Past Month Hours of Actual Sleep at Night
Property.preferredDefinition: Before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A question about an individual's hours of actual sleep at night.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.longName: Hours of Actual Sleep at Night
Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's hours of actual sleep at night.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 4/30/15; released on 08/26/2015 ylu

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the number of hours per day related to a sleep event.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 4/28/15; released on 08/26/2015 ylu

ReferenceDocuments.name: During the past month, how ma
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past month, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours you spent in bed.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available on the University of Pittsburg, Sleep Medicine Institute website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

DataElement.origin: PSQI:Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Buysse DJ, Reynolds CF, Monk TH, Berman SR, Kupfer DJ. University of Pittsburgh, 1989.
